description: From Scots caddie, from the French cadet. Doublet of cadet, caudillo, and capitellum.

entries.meaning: (golf) One hired to assist another in playing the game of golf.

verbs.description: caddy (third-person singular simple present caddies, present participle caddying, simple past and past participle caddied)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, golf) To serve as a caddy, carrying golf clubs etc.
examples: I was honored to caddy for Tiger Woods at a charity golf game.

description: Borrowed from Malay kati, a weight.

entries.meaning: A lightweight wheeled cart, often used to bring home groceries.
A small box, can, or chest to keep things in.
examples: A sauce caddy brought with the tacos offers a choice of salsa cruda, a thin puree of tomatillos, and an emulsion of red chilies.

entries.meaning: A movable tray or other mechanism for holding, securing, and transporting a removable component within a piece of equipment or machinery.
examples: Place the disc in the DVD caddy.
